p: The antibiotic resistances of the tested microorganisms have been investigated and reported in numerous studies [ 41, 42, 43, 44, 45, 46]. In their research, A.W. Khan et al. [ 42] identified a zone with an average inhibition diameter of 23 mm for E. coli ATCC 25922 when tested against antibiotic discs of tetracycline (30 µg). More than that, the antibiotic resistance of different types of MRSA has been investigated by Trzcinsky et al. [ 43]. They showed that the diameter of the inhibition zone is closely related to clinical isolation, reporting an area with an average inhibition diameter of 6 to 17 mm when the antibiotic resistance of different types of MRSA was tested with tetracycline antibiotic discs (30 μg). The antibiotic resistance of S. aureus control strains against antibiotic discs of tetracycline (30 µg) has also been tested previously [ 44, 45], indicating that the diameter of the inhibition zone was between 19 and 28 mm.
